main.*: Subscribe to the mediawiki-api-announce mailing list at <https://lists.wikimedia.org/mailman/listinfo/mediawiki-api-announce> for notice of API deprecations and breaking changes. Use [[Special:ApiFeatureUsage]] to see usage of deprecated features by your application.

revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{Taxobox | image = Cantharellus cinnabarinus.jpg | regnum = [[Fungus|Fungi]] | phylum = [[Basidiomycota]] | classis = [[Agaricomycetes]] | ordo = [[Cantharellales]] | familia = [[Cantharellaceae]] | genus = ''[[Cantharellus]]'' | species = ''''' C. cinnabarinus''''' | binomial = ''Cantharellus cinnabarinus'' | binomial_authority = ([[Lewis David von Schweinitz|Schwein.]]) Schwein. 1832 | synonyms = ''[[Agaricus]] cinnabarinus'' Schwein. 1822
''Chanterel cinnabarinus'' (Schwein.) [[William Murrill|Murrill]] 1913 }} {{mycomorphbox | name= ''Cantharellus cinnabarinus'' | whichGills=decurrent | capShape=infundibuliform | hymeniumType=ridges | stipeCharacter=bare | ecologicalType=mycorrhizal | sporePrintColor=white | sporePrintColor2=pink | howEdible=choice}} '''''Cantharellus cinnabarinus''''' is a [[fungus]] native to eastern [[North America]]. It is a member of the genus ''[[Cantharellus]]'' along with other [[chanterelle]]s. It is named after its [[cinnabar|red color]], which is imparted by the [[carotenoid]] [[canthaxanthin]]. It is [[edible mushroom|edible]], fruiting in association with [[hardwood]] trees in the summer and fall.[[Image:Cantharellus cinnabarinus.jpg|thumb|left|Freshly picked C. cinnibarinus]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web| author=Kuo, M.|date=June 2003| title=''Cantharellus cinnabarinus''| publisher=MushroomExpert.Com| url=http://www.mushroomexpert.com/cantharellus_cinnabarinus.html| accessdate=2011-03-23}} {{cite journal| title=Carotenoids of the Mushroom ''Cantharellus cinnabarinus''| first=Francis| last=Haxo| journal=Botanical Gazette| volume=112| number=2|date=Dec 1950| pages=228–32| jstor=2472791| doi=10.1086/335653}} {{cite book | last = Miller Jr.| first = Orson K. | authorlink =Orson K. Miller, Jr. |author2=Miller, Hope H. | title = North American Mushrooms: A Field Guide to Edible and Inedible Fungi | publisher = [[Globe Pequot Press]]| year = 2006| series=FalconGuides | page = 333 | isbn = 978-0-7627-3109-1 }} }} ==External links== *{{IndexFungorum|356863}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q5033735}} [[Category:Cantharellus|cinnabarinus]] [[Category:Fungi of North America]] [[Category:Edible fungi]] [[Category:Fungi described in 1832]] {{Agaricomycetes-stub}}
